description: Triangular array T given by rows: T(n,k)=sum of remainders when Euclidean algorithm acts on n,k; for k=1,2,...,n; n >= 1.
comments: For a fixed n, {(k,T(n,k)), k=1..n} is conjectured to be fractal in nature (see link). - _Tiberiu Szocs-Mihai_, Aug 17 2015
links: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10011 (rows 1 to 141, flattened)
Tiberiu Szocs-Mihai, Euclidean fractal (conjectured), Math Ticks Blog, January 2011.
Tiberiu Szocs-Mihai, Euclidean fractal candidate description, Math Ticks Blog, January 2011.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Euclidean Algorithm.
maple: T:=  proc(n,k) option remember;if n*k = 0 then 0 else (n mod k) + procname(k,n mod k) fiend proc:seq(seq(T(n,k),k=1..n), n=1..20); # _Robert Israel_, Aug 31 2015
prog: (PARI) tabl(nn) = {for (n=1, nn, for (k=1, n, a = n; b = k; r = 1; s = 0; while (r, q = a\b; r = a - b*q; s +=r; a = b; b = r); print1(s, ", ");); print(););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 17 2015
author: _Clark Kimberling_
